contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|Elysian Fields}} '''Elysian Fields''' may refer to: {{tocright}} ==General use== * [[Elysium]] (or the Elysian Fields), in Greek mythology, the final resting places of the souls of the heroic and the virtuous. It was ruled by Hades. == Places == * [[Elysian Fields, Hoboken, New Jersey]], site of the first organized base ball game * [[Elysian Fields Avenue]], New Orleans, a setting and a symbolic element in ''A Streetcar Named Desire'' * [[Elysian Fields, Texas]] * Avenue of the Elysian Fields, ''[[Champs-Élysées]]'', major thoroughfare in Paris == Music and entertainment == * [[Elysian Fields (band)]], an American art rock band * The song "Elysian Fields" by the band Megadeth. * The song "Elysian Fields" by the [[hip hop]] artist Heath McNease. * The song "Elysian Fields" by [[Andy_Moor_(musician)|Andy Moor]] and Carrie Skipper. * A music festival held the first weekend of August in [[Boyce, Virginia#Elysian Fields|Boyce, Virginia]] * Elysian Fields by the band God is an Astronaut. ==Other== *[[Elysian Fields Quarterly]] == See also == * [[Elysian (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation}}
